abstract: Ivanhoe Mines said on Monday it is launching a rights offering worth up to $1 billion, to raise funds for its Oyu Tolgoi copper-gold project in Mongolia, but the plan may well escalate hostilities between the company and its partner Rio Tinto.
snippet: Ivanhoe Mines said on Monday it is launching a rights offering worth up to $1 billion, to raise funds for its Oyu Tolgoi copper-gold project in Mongolia, but the plan may well escalate hostilities between the company and its partner Rio Tinto.
lead_paragraph: Ivanhoe Mines has said it is starting a rights offering worth up to $1 billion, to raise money for its Oyu Tolgoi copper-gold project in Mongolia, but the plan may well escalate hostilities between the company and its partner, Rio Tinto, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Ivanhoe Mines Offering May Raise Tensions With Rio Tinto
